intro: Stenospermation ellipticum, commonly known as the narrow-seeded elliptic plant, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in shaded woodland environments. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed structure that splits open to release tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
